result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Shope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: William A Shope
parties.address: PO Box 7969, Supervised Living Facility, Madison, WI 53707-7969

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 4 years of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medications only as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with BMO Harris Bank.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment and residence.
